Award.AwardTitle: Group Travel to the 12th International Symposium on Antarctic Earth Sciences (ISAES), Goa, India
Award.AbstractNarration:
The International Symposium on Antarctic Earth Sciences (ISAES) is held every four years and is a premier conference for the presentation of the latest scientific research in Antarctica. The 12th ISAES meeting will be held 13-17 July 2015 in Goa, India. In previous symposia, U.S. scientists made important contributions to the success of the meetings. These funds will be used to support the travel costs associated with the attendance of approximately 19 U.S. Earth scientists, enabling them to present their scientific findings and benefit from the scholarly exchange of ideas. The highest priority will be given to graduate students and early career investigators who do not have other resources to offset their travel costs. Requests for travel support will be evaluated by the two project PIs along with a group of geoscientists from the Byrd Polar and Climate Research Center and School of Earth Sciences at The Ohio State University.

The scientific program for ISAES 2015 emphasizes interdisciplinary research that places Antarctica in a global context, and is of interest to all Earth scientists. The meeting provides essential perspective for students and early-career researchers. The science themes include: Antarctica, the Southern Ocean, and the Evolution of Climate and the Global Cryosphere; Biodiversity and the Evolution of Life; Antarctic Surface Processes, Landscapes, and Links with Cryosphere and Climate; Antarctica and supercontinent evolution and Frontiers in Antarctic Earth Science, amongst many other topics. Symposium presentations and publications provide a key record of research activities in Antarctic Earth Sciences, and an invaluable resource for planning future, international, collaborative research.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Group Travel to the 12th International Symposium on Antarctic Earth Sciences (ISAES), Goa, India, award provided funding for 20 U.S. scientists to present their research results at the preeminent international Antarctic earth science research conference. The International Symposium on Antarctic Earth Sciences (ISAES) meets every four years under the auspices of the Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research (SCAR). The meeting is an international, interdisciplinary one that brings together earth scientists and other from around the world to report their scientific results involving the exploration of all aspects of Antarctic and Southern Ocean geology and its linkages to glaciology, oceanography, biological sciences, and climatology. The meeting traditionally attracts 300-400 scientists from up to 35 countries. The meeting provides a forum to present and discuss the most recent scientific findings as well as to delineate research priorities, to establish international collaborations and to develop international programs. The scientific program for ISAES 2015 emphasized interdisciplinary research that places Antarctica in a global context, which provided essential perspective for students and early-career researchers.

 

Training and outreach components formed the core of the award activity. The ISAES provides a key platform for generating or augmenting international collaborations not generally available for graduate students and early-career researchers.  The funds from this award allowed a diverse group of researchers (90% students and early-career scientists) to participate in defining the future directions of Antarctic earth science research and encouraged them to develop global collaboration and cooperation. It augmented the training and development of graduate students and young investigators as they engaged in multifaceted opportunities to interact with the international community of Antarctic researchers.
